summary: For a drabble;; tony having a really bad panic attack and Rhodes making sure he’s ok? I love me sum platonic friends🤧🤧
question: For a drabble;; tony having a really bad panic attack and Rhodes making sure he’s ok? I love me sum platonic friends🤧🤧
answer:
I’m so sorry this took me a week to get to.  

I’m rewriting/expanding the scene in Iron Man 3 where Tony and Rhodey are at a restaurant and the kid wants Tony to sign their drawing and Tony starts panicking about the battle in New York.

_____

JARVIS’s report does nothing to still the rapid thrumming of Tony’s heart.  So what if his vitals are fine?  He doesn’t feel fine.  As a matter of fact, he still feels like he’s dying.  

Tony releases himself from his suit just as Rhodey appears in the parking lot.  He spies Tony and rushes over in time to keep him from bashing his knees on the pavement.

“Ok, easy,” Rhodey says, sinking into a squat by Tony’s shoulder.  “What happened?”

“God,” Tony gasps.  “Fuck.  When people say…panic attack…” He shakes his head.  “It doesn’t seem like it’d feel like…like this…”  Tony’s ability to form words fades as the tightness in his chest leaches into his throat.  He swallows.  He feels sick.

“Ok,” Rhodey intones.  “Ok.  I got you.”  He shifts so one arm encircles Tony’s shoulders from the back, and the other from the front.  “You’re safe.”

“Hm.”  Rhodey’s words make sense.  He sounds like he knows what he’s doing.  The minuscule area of Tony’s brain that’s still firing reminds him what his friend does for a living.  Of course he knows what he’s doing.  But it doesn’t make it any easier to believe him.  

“I’m gonna count you down, and you’re gonna breathe.  Sound good?”  

Good is a bit of a stretch, but it’s manageable.  Maybe.  

“Ten,” Rhodey starts.  “In and out, come on.  Nine.”

Tony’s so nauseous he’s afraid of what will happen when he opens his mouth, but he does anyway.  He sucks in the winter air between his gritted teeth.

“Good.  Eight.  You got this.  Seven.”  Rhodey moves his hand and taps his palm between Tony’s shoulder blades.  

Tony’s lungs seem to get the message, and he exhales.  Then inhales.  It’s easy now.  He wonders why he forgot how to do that to begin with.

“Alright.  See, it’s ok.”  Rhodey finishes counting, then slowly gives Tony a few feet of space.  “You back with me?” he asks.

“Yup.”  Tony doesn’t trust himself to say anything more.  He doesn’t really want to either.

“You ok to get back home?  I can give you a ride.”

“Yeah, I’m good.”  Tony gets to his feet.

“I don’t mind,” Rhodey says.  “You don’t have to talk about it or anything.”

“I know.”  Tony steps toward his suit.  “But your car’s slow.”

summary: How Harley Keener Could Be The Next Iron Man
title: How Harley Keener Could Be The Next Iron Man
body: Ty Simpkins (Harley Keener) was listed on the Avengers 4 cast list. What the hell is this random character from Iron Man 3 doing in Avengers 4? Well Harley was 10 at the time of Iron Man 3 which was set in 2013, do some basic math and he is about 16 and up, since we have absolutely no idea what year Avengers 4 is set in. (Harley’s birthday is also not listed anywhere.) Since Rdj’s contract is going to run out after that movie it would be the perfect time to replace Iron Man. Now marvel is smart enough to know that they just can’t replace Rdj, because he basically is Tony Stark, but what if we replace the character but not necessarily the actor? If ya still don’t get it I think Harley will take up the mantle as Iron Man. Now unfortunately Iron Man will not be leading the MCU anymore, nor will he be the face of it. That job goes to Captain Marvel

summary: Tony Stark
body:
Tony Stark

I love Tony Stark. The guy who created Dum-E as a child and low key hasn’t alerted him since. That guy who wishes he told his dad he loved him before he died, regardless of the fact that he’d never heard his old man say it back. That dude who didn’t hesitate when he took out his arc reactor to save not only himself but others. That bro who knows his forehead of sercuity’s favorite show. That selfless guy who still makes tech for his teammates despite them repeatedly stabbing him in the back multiple times. The role model to just wants to do good by Peter Parker. The guy who just wants to protect the world and everyone in it from bad things. Ya, that guy. I love him, and he is my hero. Stop demonizing Tony Stark and accept that he is a HERO. Maybe not the most likely of heroes, but in his own way, he is a hero. And he’s saved my life.

title: Immunity
body:

by spideyandstark

As Ned waits to have the anti-flu injection, he realises that his superhero best friend must be immune. Spider-blood has gotta have some sort of advantage over the common cold.

Right?

(Spoilers - he’s wrong.)

title: Even the Bravest
body:
read it on the AO3 at https://ift.tt/2OtpNid

by Webhoard

Steve goes on an undercover mission to catch Castillo, the arms dealer who had attacked him just over a year ago. But when he goes missing in action, you have to keep it together long enough to find him…which is easier said than done.

This is a 4-part? (might be more?) sequel of sorts for Even the Smallest, based on a batch of the requests I got. See my masterlist if you’re curious where I’m headed with this sequel.

summary: Hell
body:
Hell

Angst Angst Angst Angst…

I suppose this is also a little bit thanks to @nightwinggirl42 you asked for more marvel writing  (granted that was a while ago lmao I’m so slow) and you shall receive. I really hope it lives up to whatever you had in mind.

Anthony Stark sat in the dust, his fists clenched and his breathing heavy and uneven. The only other soul on the entire planet with him was a cyborg he had never met before today. Tony starred into the distance blinking quickly, swallowing the growing lump in his throat and trying to suppress the sobs rising. He pressed a hand to his mouth trying to quiet the cries, maybe pass it off as a cough.

“Mr. Stark?” the voice asked from behind him. Tony closed his eyes, trying to steady himself. Mr. Stark I-I don’t feel so good.

“Yes?” Tony’s voice cracked. Nebula chose to ignore it.

“Where should we go now? We might be able to track down Thanos,” Nebula said, already trying to formulate a plan. Tony scolded himself for not keeping up, he had to stay ahead of the purple goon. The goon who just took everything.

“Right,” Tony agreed standing up. “We…We should head back to earth, some of the avengers must still be alive…and uh we’ll formulate the rest of the plan with them there.” Tony’s mind raced a mile a minute, trying to block the ache both in his side and chest and the wetness in his eyes. “Your ship! Where’s your ship that you used to get here?”

Would there be an avengers to return to?

Nebula led Tony, who was limping and stumbling around from his wounds to the vessel she had used to arrive. When she uncovered it though they found it to be halfway crushed under the remains of the moon that had been used in the earlier fight.

“Dammit,” Nebula muttered as she pushed the debris off her ship. “That purple bastard,”  

“Tony Stark!” The magician stepped out of his magic portal, solemn and determined. “I’m Doctor Stephen Strange. I need you to come with me.”

“Uhhh,” Tony stuttered leaning on a piece of rock. “I-can-um ah ha! Yeah okay I can fix this, um I’ve got spare parts somewhere in here-” he gestured to his suit “we can fix this!”

Nebula stared at the man for a moment before nodding. “Yes, let me just finish this. What do you need?”

“Nothing,” Tony said quickly. “I mean-I’ll inspect it first then figure that out.” he closed his eyes trying to calm himself down.

“Sup Mr. Stark,” The kid stood over him holding back the oncoming attack.

“Kid where you’d come from?”

“A fieldtrip-AH!” he started before being thrown into the air.

“Mr. Stark why don’t you rest for a little bit, I’ll start on this.” Nebula told him, Tony’s eyes shot open.

“What? No, no it’s fine!” Tony reassured her shaking his head. “Just get- just get the rubble off it and I can get to work on getting us back to earth,”

Nebula resumed her task and the two stood in silence.

“And this suit is ridiculously intuitive by the way so if anything it’s kinda your fault that I’m here,” Peter stumbled on his words. Tony looked at him for a moment.

“What did you just say?” Tony asked.

“-I-I take that back,”

“You were right kid,” Tony thought to himself. “It was my fault that you ended up here.” He inhaled sharply, closing his eyes and licked his lips. “Dammit I was such a dumbass,”

Strange’s head was shaking back and forth crazily, Tony ran over to him grabbing his hand as Stephen fell back to the ground yelling.

“You’re back, you’re alright,” Tony said.

“What was that?” Starlord asked from behind them. Stephen looked at them all with barely controlled panic in his eyes.

Nebula finished moving the rock off of the remains of her ship. Tony walked over and nodded. “Thanks, I’ll get to work on this,”

Nebula nodded before walking away, Tony vaguely wondered where she was going but at the same time didn’t care. He had other things to worry about. Kneeling on the ground he gently pushed wires and scraps of metal around trying to find out if anything was missing.

“It was the only way,” Stephen said quietly. Brown eyes met the the doctor’s, what color were they? Blue or green? Maybe a color all their own. Before Tony Doctor Strange turned to dust. What was going on?

Tony quickened his pace, eyes scanning over the wreckage and biting his lip. The engine was almost completely crushed. He pinched the bridge of his noes and sighed.

“I can fix this,” Tony muttered to himself as he started with the rest of his ship.

~

Tony had lost track of time, his eyesight was getting blurry and Nebula still hadn’t returned. But the engine was fixed and the only thing missing from the ship were the windows. Which Tony didn’t think was needed as Nebula was a cyborg and he had his suit…at least most of his suit as he used parts of it to replace the ship.

“Something’s happening…” Mantis said nervously as she looked about her, everyone starred at her confused for moment, but as a crack of thunder rang through the air she turned to dust and was carried away with the wind.

“Quill?” Drax asked fearfully looking at his arm. Starlord had horror etched across his face as Drax disappeared.

“Steady Quill?” Tony asked stepping near him.

“Oh man,” Quill whispered before turning to dust.

“Nebula!” Tony shouted, his voice was raspy and he broke into a coughing fir as he tried to scan the area for her. Tony coughed up blood, but ignored it as he continued the search for his new comrade.

He found the cyborg sitting at the edge of a valley that stretched as far as his eyes could see. Tony sighed as he walked over to her, trying to shake off the growing headache.

“Nebula?” Tony asked, she quickly turned to face him standing up.

“Yes sir?” she asked standing in perfect uniform with her voice stern, yet the tear rolling down her face betrayed her. Tony looked at her crestfallen.

“Are you doing okay?” Tony asked worrying about how she was fairing after recent events.

“Fine sir,” she nodded. Tony shook his head.

“Kid…” Tony started, his voice shook a little, “It’s…It’s okay, we’re-we’re going to go to earth-go to earth and get the avengers-kick Thanos’s ass-kick his ass and everyone will return…” Tony said, he spoke those words yet in his heart he didn’t know if that was true, he didn’t know what was true anymore.

Nebula nodded. “Of course,” she said her voice not showing a hint of pain, yet her eyes welled up with tears. Tony sighed and held out his arms for her, he didn’t know her well, but that didn’t stop him from wanting to console her. She hesitated for a moment, not quite sure of what to do before walking forward and collapsing in his arms, sobbing.

Tony looked to the wizard, his oak tree eyes with guilt swirling in them. He wanted to know why, why. He wasn’t supposed to give up the stone. Stephen panted tiredly as he could barely bring his eyes to meet Tony’s.

“There was no other way.” Stephen said, his voice sorry and heartbroken.

“We won’t get her back, oh my god she wasn’t taken by the dust he killed her we can’t get her back,” Nebula sobbed into his armor. Her voice robotic yet more human than some people Tony had met throughout his life. Tony wasn’t completely sure of who Nebula cried about, his only guess was Gamora. The person he guardians had been looking for when he met them, the person Quill had attacked Thanos for.

He wanted to tell her that everything would work out. That they’d all be alright, that people would be waiting for them who could help. But he couldn’t, he wasn’t sure of anything anymore.

Slowly Nebula’s sobs slowed down, until Titan was silent. Nebula backed away and whipped the tears off her face. “We should be going,”

Tony nodded, he hobbled behind her as they walked back to the ship. Nebula reached the ship before him and climbed in. Tony hesitated, turning away to shield his face from her. He wanted to be given time to scream, to cry to damn his whole life.

“Mr. Stark?”

But it was time to walk through hell.

“I don’t feel so good,” Tony faced Peter, fear etched into the teenager’s face.

“You’re alright,” Tony said trying to quickly comfort his son.

“I don’t-I don’t know what’s happening-I don’t understand,” Peter rambled shaking as he fell into Tony’s arms. Peter held onto him for life. “I don’t want to go I don’t want to go! Sir please, please. I don’t want go, I don’t want to go please!” Tony gently layed him on the ground tears welled up in both of their eyes, they didn’t know what was happening. Peter could feel it, he tried to fight back with every inch of his being but he could feel himself slipping away. “I’m sorry.”

Hell better be prepared because he was prepared to fight the entire universe after what it had done to him.

Where’s your ship that you used to get here?”

Would there be an avengers to return to?

Nebula led Tony, who was limping and stumbling around from his wounds to the vessel she had used to arrive. When she uncovered it though they found it to be halfway crushed under the remains of the moon that had been used in the earlier fight.

“Dammit,” Nebula muttered as she pushed the debris off her ship. “That purple bastard,”  

“Tony Stark!” The magician stepped out of his magic portal, solemn and determined. “I’m Doctor Stephen Strange. I need you to come with me.”

“Uhhh,” Tony stuttered leaning on a piece of rock. “I-can-um ah ha! Yeah okay I can fix this, um I’ve got spare parts somewhere in here-” he gestured to his suit “we can fix this!”

Nebula stared at the man for a moment before nodding. “Yes, let me just finish this. What do you need?”

“Nothing,” Tony said quickly. “I mean-I’ll inspect it first then figure that out.” he closed his eyes trying to calm himself down.

“Sup Mr. Stark,” The kid stood over him holding back the oncoming attack.

“Kid where you’d come from?”

“A fieldtrip-AH!” he started before being thrown into the air.

“Mr. Stark why don’t you rest for a little bit, I’ll start on this.” Nebula told him, Tony’s eyes shot open.

“What? No, no it’s fine!” Tony reassured her shaking his head. “Just get- just get the rubble off it and I can get to work on getting us back to earth,”

Nebula resumed her task and the two stood in silence.

“And this suit is ridiculously intuitive by the way so if anything it’s kinda your fault that I’m here,” Peter stumbled on his words. Tony looked at him for a moment.

“What did you just say?” Tony asked.

“-I-I take that back,”

“You were right kid,” Tony thought to himself. “It was my fault that you ended up here.” He inhaled sharply, closing his eyes and licked his lips. “Dammit I was such a dumbass,”

Strange’s head was shaking back and forth crazily, Tony ran over to him grabbing his hand as Stephen fell back to the ground yelling.

“You’re back, you’re alright,” Tony said.

“What was that?” Starlord asked from behind them. Stephen looked at them all with barely controlled panic in his eyes.

Nebula finished moving the rock off of the remains of her ship. Tony walked over and nodded. “Thanks, I’ll get to work on this,”

Nebula nodded before walking away, Tony vaguely wondered where she was going but at the same time didn’t care. He had other things to worry about. Kneeling on the ground he gently pushed wires and scraps of metal around trying to find out if anything was missing.

“It was the only way,” Stephen said quietly. Brown eyes met the the doctor’s, what color were they? Blue or green? Maybe a color all their own. Before Tony Doctor Strange turned to dust. What was going on?

Tony quickened his pace, eyes scanning over the wreckage and biting his lip. The engine was almost completely crushed. He pinched the bridge of his noes and sighed.

“I can fix this,” Tony muttered to himself as he started with the rest of his ship.

~

Tony had lost track of time, his eyesight was getting blurry and Nebula still hadn’t returned. But the engine was fixed and the only thing missing from the ship were the windows. Which Tony didn’t think was needed as Nebula was a cyborg and he had his suit…at least most of his suit as he used parts of it to replace the ship.

“Something’s happening…” Mantis said nervously as she looked about her, everyone starred at her confused for moment, but as a crack of thunder rang through the air she turned to dust and was carried away with the wind.

“Quill?” Drax asked fearfully looking at his arm. Starlord had horror etched across his face as Drax disappeared.

“Steady Quill?” Tony asked stepping near him.

“Oh man,” Quill whispered before turning to dust.

“Nebula!” Tony shouted, his voice was raspy and he broke into a coughing fir as he tried to scan the area for her. Tony coughed up blood, but ignored it as he continued the search for his new comrade.

He found the cyborg sitting at the edge of a valley that stretched as far as his eyes could see. Tony sighed as he walked over to her, trying to shake off the growing headache.

“Nebula?” Tony asked, she quickly turned to face him standing up.

“Yes sir?” she asked standing in perfect uniform with her voice stern, yet the tear rolling down her face betrayed her. Tony looked at her crestfallen.

“Are you doing okay?” Tony asked worrying about how she was fairing after recent events.

“Fine sir,” she nodded. Tony shook his head.

“Kid…” Tony started, his voice shook a little, “It’s…It’s okay, we’re-we’re going to go to earth-go to earth and get the avengers-kick Thanos’s ass-kick his ass and everyone will return…” Tony said, he spoke those words yet in his heart he didn’t know if that was true, he didn’t know what was true anymore.

Nebula nodded. “Of course,” she said her voice not showing a hint of pain, yet her eyes welled up with tears. Tony sighed and held out his arms for her, he didn’t know her well, but that didn’t stop him from wanting to console her. She hesitated for a moment, not quite sure of what to do before walking forward and collapsing in his arms, sobbing.

Tony looked to the wizard, his oak tree eyes with guilt swirling in them. He wanted to know why, why. He wasn’t supposed to give up the stone. Stephen panted tiredly as he could barely bring his eyes to meet Tony’s.

“There was no other way.” Stephen said, his voice sorry and heartbroken.

“We won’t get her back, oh my god she wasn’t taken by the dust he killed her we can’t get her back,” Nebula sobbed into his armor. Her voice robotic yet more human than some people Tony had met throughout his life. Tony wasn’t completely sure of who Nebula cried about, his only guess was Gamora. The person he guardians had been looking for when he met them, the person Quill had attacked Thanos for.

He wanted to tell her that everything would work out. That they’d all be alright, that people would be waiting for them who could help. But he couldn’t, he wasn’t sure of anything anymore.

Slowly Nebula’s sobs slowed down, until Titan was silent. Nebula backed away and whipped the tears off her face. “We should be going,”

Tony nodded, he hobbled behind her as they walked back to the ship. Nebula reached the ship before him and climbed in. Tony hesitated, turning away to shield his face from her. He wanted to be given time to scream, to cry to damn his whole life.

“Mr. Stark?”

But it was time to walk through hell.

“I don’t feel so good,” Tony faced Peter, fear etched into the teenager’s face.

“You’re alright,” Tony said trying to quickly comfort his son.

“I don’t-I don’t know what’s happening-I don’t understand,” Peter rambled shaking as he fell into Tony’s arms. Peter held onto him for life. “I don’t want to go I don’t want to go! Sir please, please. I don’t want go, I don’t want to go please!” Tony gently layed him on the ground tears welled up in both of their eyes, they didn’t know what was happening. Peter could feel it, he tried to fight back with every inch of his being but he could feel himself slipping away. “I’m sorry.”

Hell better be prepared because he was prepared to fight the entire universe after what it had done to him.
